Message.Title: The Obama EPA blamed in layoff of 138 workers at coal company
Message.Msg: The Obama EPA is directly blamed for the layoff of 138 workers in Somerset PA. PBS Coals announced Thursday that it has once again reduced its work force. The company informed 138 employees from various sites that they were losing their jobs. In addition to the employees, the Hart mine in Stonycreek Township and Roytown mine in Lincoln Township were idled. PBS officials said the layoffs are necessary because of soft coal markets and increased pressure from the Environmental Protection Agency, which has increased costs.

Topic.Title: Goldman Price target For Yahoo Raised to $24

Message.Msg: Goldman Sachs analyst Heath Terry this morning added Yahoo to the firm’s Conviction Buy List, boosting his target on the stock to $24, from $22. “With capital allocation actions serving as a catalyst to drive a revaluation in the stock, we believe the value of Yahoo’s balance sheet assets and the core business are worth more than the current stock price,” he writes in research note. “In our opinion, this revaluation, along with recent clarity on the turnaround and channel checks signaling effective management of the organization’s structure, investments and finances, creates a very attractive risk/reward scenario, particularly given the early reaction in the stock to the buyback and the roughly 75% of the buyback that still remains. ” Terry notes that the company has repurchased 54.4 million shares year to date for $858 million, with $212 million of that in Q4 through November. The company has committed to buying back another $2.792 billion, or about 13% of the current market cap, from the cash received in the sale of part of Yahoo’s Alibaba stake back to the company

Message.Msg: Goldman Sachs analyst Heath Terry this morning added Yahoo to the firm’s Conviction Buy List, boosting his target on the stock to $24, from $22.

Message.Title: The US Government Just Gave Alibaba The Green Light to IPO, Helping Yahoo
Message.Msg: In a move that largely went unnoticed yesterday in the US, the American government decided to remove Taobao from its annual global list of “notorious markets.”

Topic.Title: The US Government Just Gave Alibaba The Green Light to IPO, Helping Yahoo

Message.Msg: Now that this is resolved, will Alibaba Group IPO immediately? No one knows except maybe Jack Ma. However, after the last financing round which allowed Alibaba to buy back half of the stake Yahoo (YHOO) owns in the company, Alibaba has many new investors who are eager to see liquidity. So, it certainly wouldn’t surprise me to see Alibaba Group IPO in the next year.
